text: Policy Name: Attendance Policy Purpose: This policy defines the rules and expectations related to employee attendance and punctuality. Working Hours: The standard working hours are from 9:30 AM to 6:30 PM, Monday to Friday. Employees are expected to log in on time and complete their assigned working hours. Attendance Marking: Employees must mark their attendance using the official attendance system provided by the company. Attendance should be marked at the start and end of the workday. Late Arrival: Employees arriving more than 15 minutes late will be marked as late. Frequent late arrivals may result in disciplinary action. Absenteeism: An employee will be considered absent if attendance is not marked for the day and no prior approval is taken. Unapproved absence may lead to loss of pay. Regularization: Employees can regularize missed or incorrect attendance entries through the attendance portal. Regularization requests must be submitted within 3 working days. Compliance: Failure to comply with the attendance policy may lead to corrective action by HR.

Policy Name: Leave Policy Purpose: This policy outlines the types of leave available to employees and the rules for availing them. Casual Leave: Employees are entitled to 12 casual leaves per calendar year. Casual leave is intended for short-term personal needs. Unused casual leave cannot be carried forward to the next year. Sick Leave: Employees are entitled to 10 sick leaves per year. Sick leave can be used in case of illness or medical emergencies. Medical certificates may be required for sick leave exceeding 2 consecutive days. Earned Leave: Employees earn 15 earned leaves per year. Earned leave can be accumulated and carried forward up to a maximum of 45 days. Leave Application Process: All leave requests must be submitted through the official leave management system. Leave should be approved by the reporting manager before availing. Unapproved Leave: Leaves taken without approval may be treated as loss of pay.

Policy Name: Work From Home Policy Purpose: This policy defines the guidelines for employees working remotely. Eligibility: Employees may opt for work from home based on project requirements and manager approval. Not all roles are eligible for work from home. WFH Duration: Employees are allowed up to 8 work from home days per month. Additional work from home days require special approval. Working Hours: Employees working from home must adhere to standard working hours. Availability during core business hours is mandatory. Performance Expectations: Employees are expected to maintain the same level of productivity while working remotely. Regular updates should be provided to the reporting manager. Security: Employees must ensure company data is accessed only through secure devices and networks. Sharing information while working remotely is strictly prohibited.
